title: Home
text:
Welcome
This is a non-denominational Christian Bible study. The author uses the New International Version (NIV) or New King James Version (NKJV) when developing these studies. If you do not have a NIV or NKJV Bible, you can find one online:
Bible Gateway
Bible Study Tools


Studies
There are year-long studies for you to choose. Each study has a topic for every month of the year. There are Bible verses for each week of the month.
Even though these studies were written in years past, do not hesitate to (re)visit them as often as you feel led to do so.

Study 1


Study 2


Study 3



Study Tips

Pray and seek wisdom and understanding from the Holy Spirit.
Read the Bible verse for the week multiple times to gain meaning and context.
Journal your thoughts for reflection later.

What is the lesson or message? Is it providing instruction?
How can we apply the text in our current life?




Poems
Please enjoy some GOD-centered acrostic poems designed to encourage your spirit and faith walk.

May GOD be glorified in your life!



Photo by Aaron Burden on Unsplash

title: 01 | Fresh Anointing & Blocking Out Fear
text:
January marks a new year on the calendar. Most people think you have to have a ‘resolution’ for the New Year. Some resolutions are hopeful, some are made out of fear. In Christ, anytime can be a new year! Ask Him for a fresh anointing for wisdom and courage to face any new year in your life.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Isaiah 41:10

Week 2

Deuteronomy 1:21

Week 3

2 Timothy 1:7

Week 4

Isaiah 35:4

title: 02 | Love
text:
Love is celebrated in February. This custom brings joy to some and sorrow to others. Remember GOD’s love for us has no beginning and no end. His word tells us: “Love covers a multitude of sin.” Let’s celebrate GOD’s love for us!
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

1 Psalms 117

Week 2

2 John 16:27

Week 3

3 Proverbs 10:12

Week 4

1 John 4: 7-8

title: 03 | Wind
text:
Wind is unseen but felt. Wind can cause blizzards, hurricanes or tornadoes. It can also bring relief on a hot summer day. Wind provides a wonderful way for sails on a boat to move or a balloon to take you up into the sky. Life can be like the wind: bitter and sweet. Trust GOD no matter where the wind takes you.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Hosea 8:7

Week 2

John 3:8

Week 3

Psalms 55:8

Week 4

Matt. 7:25

Week 5

Mark 4:39

title: 04 | New Growth
text:
Spring issues in a season of new growth and warmth after a cold winter. The cold allows us time to stay indoors to listen to the Holy Spirit, develop new ideas and begin the process for new growth. New growth can occur in many ways. It can occur by changing habits, learning a new skill, teaching a bible study, or taking a class and other things. Seek GOD and ask Him for ways to produce new growth in you.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Ephesians 4:15

Week 2

Isaiah 43:19

Week 3

Colossians 1:6

Week 4

Psalms 126:5-6

title: 05 | Mercy & Stillness
text:
The word of GOD tells us that GOD’s mercy never ends. I have found that most of us appreciate this when it applies to us. But, we dislike this when it comes to those that have hurt us. GOD commands us to love one another as He loves us. A part of loving someone is extending mercy in situations where it is needed, even when it is not requested. Thank you, Lord, for mercy: May we extend it to others as you have/do to us.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

1 Chronicles 21:13

Week 2

Luke 1:50

Week 3

Psalms 23:6

Week 4

Ephesians 2:4

title: 06 | Waves
text:
At times, it seems like our lives move in waves. Waves of hope, sorrow, fear, joy and peace. No matter which waves we are riding, GOD is present. During our seasons of riding whichever wave life gives us, we must remember to keep our eyes on the Lord. He can and will keep us in his care through the waves of life.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Job 38:1 and 11

Week 2

Psalms 65:7

Week 3

Psalms 107:29 and 29:7

Week 4

Matt 8:27

title: 07 | Freedom & Liberty
text:
“Freedom” is a word that invokes many emotions, depending on your circumstances. We should all strive to have freedom from fear, harmful thoughts and worry. Christ’s death on the cross guarantees us freedom from all of these things and more.
Once we accept Jesus as our savior, we are saved and free. True freedom comes from walking with Him. My hope is that we tap into the freedom that only Jesus gives!
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Galatians 5:1

Week 2

Psalms 119:45

Week 3

Ephesians 3:12

Week 4

Isaiah 61:1

Week 5

Romans 8:2

title: 08 | Peace
text:
Peace is precious and cannot be bought. We as a society look for peace in things and places. These places and things include bars, gyms, cars, food and, hopefully, church. True peace can only be found in Jesus Christ! His word tells us to seek Him, and He will give us peace in every area of our lives. May we seek and obtain the peace that only GOD gives.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

1 Peter 3:11

Week 2

John 16:33

Week 3

Isaiah 60:17

Week 4

Proverbs 3:17

Week 5

Isaiah 26:3

title: 09 | Changes
text:
Fall is a season that often appears to have the most drastic physical changes. The leaves on trees turn beautiful colors and, then, fall to the ground; we gather and dispose of them. This could also be a time to make changes in our attitude and outlook. Letting some things “fall away” or change. GOD wants us to ‘fall’ into His word and allow it to visibly and spiritually change us.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Daniel 2:21

Week 2

Psalms 102:26

Week 3

1 Corinthians 15: 51-52

Week 4

Malachi 3:6

title: 10 | Forgiveness
text:
Forgiveness is a choice and a process. We have to choose to forgive if we want to be forgiven by our heavenly father. When we choose to forgive, the sometimes long process of restoring begins. By the power of the Holy Spirit, we extend the same grace and mercy that has been extended to us. As time moves on, we will find that the hurt and pain that was caused has lessened. Our hearts and minds are free towards the person and can focus on God.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Acts 10:43

Week 2

Psalms 130:4

Week 3

Colossians 1:13-14

Week 4

Psalms 32:5

title: 11 | Justice
text:
At some point in everyone’s life, we seek justice and provide justice. Justice comes in many forms. It can be simple or complex. Simple justice may look like fixing something you broke. Complex justice can look like providing restitution and restoring all parties involved. GOD’s justice is simple and complex. Complex because He sent His only son to die for our sins. Simple because we just need to receive it.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Hosea 12:6

Week 2

Exodus 14:14

Week 3

Micah 6:8

Week 4

Matthew 23:23

Week 5

Nahum 1:7

title: 12 | Humility
text:
As I reflect on the year and this season, the word “humility” captures the posture of my heart. I am humbled that the Lord allowed me to see another calendar year. I am awed and amazed by the story of the birth of Christ (never gets old) and the joy in the atmosphere! I am humbled by the willingness of strangers to share with one another. I am so thankful for Jesus who humbled Himself to save us.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Proverbs 15:33

Week 2

Acts 20:19

Week 3

2 Chronicles 7:14

Week 4

Luke 18:14

title: 01 | Refuge
text:
Refuge is another name for shelter. A shelter is a place we go to for comfort, to feel protected from storms and safe from trouble. CHRIST is our refuge a place of comfort, protection and a safe place for our spirit when it is troubled!

Week 1

Psalms 57:1-2

Week 2

Psalms 62:1-6

Week 3

Psalms 62:7-12

Week 4

Psalms 18:30

Week 5

Psalms 91: 1-2

title: 02 | Redeemed
text:
As we ponder what redeemed means in our faith walk, we may think of different things. Most of us think of our lives or souls. Others may think of time and situations. Whatever way you ponder the word “redeemed,” make sure JESUS is a part of it.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Isaiah 43:1-4

Week 2

Psalms 31: 5

Week 3

1 Peter 1:18-19

Week 4

Galatians 3:13-14

title: 03 | Renew
text:
The prefix “re” means to do again. In life, it is a priviledge when we are allowed to redo things. JESUS, by His spirit, renews us. He makes us new again.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Zephaniah 3:17

Week 2

Lamentations 3: 22-23

Week 3

2 Corinthians 4:16

Week 4

Colossians 3: 9-10

title: 04 | Rest
text:
Rest is essential for good health and mental well being. As scripture tells us, we also need rest for our souls. The LORD tells us to come to Him, and He will give us rest. May we seek the rest that only GOD gives!
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Job 11:18

Week 2

Jeremiah 6:16

Week 3

Matthew 11: 28-30

Week 4

Hebrews 4: 1-3

Week 5

Psalms 116: 5-7

title: 05 | Eternal
text:
“Eternal” means something that lasts forever. We are encouraged to set our hearts on things eternal. These things include our relationship with CHRIST and following His precepts needed for eternal life. May our thoughts and actions lead us to eternal life.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Mark 10:17

Week 2

John 12:49-50

Week 3

Romans 2:7-8

Week 4

Corinthians 4: 17-18

Week 5

John 2: 24-25

title: 06 | Faithful
text:
When we think of the word “faithful,” we picture someone who is consistent: consistent in their words and actions. You know what they will do and say in most situations. GOD is consistent and faithful in HIS love and care for us.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Deuteronomy 32:4

Week 2

Psalms 101:6

Week 3

Luke 16:10-11

Week 4

Thessalonians 3:3

title: 07 | Fruit
text:
Fruit can be bitter and sweet. Fruit that is not ripe is hard and bitter. Ripe fruit fruit is juicy and sweet. May we all allow the Holy Spirit to ripen our fruit (love, joy, peace, etc.) so that it is sweet to all who experience it.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Micah 6:7-8

Week 2

James 1:18-19

Week 3

Proverbs 8:19-20

Week 4

Galatians 5:22-24

Week 5

Luke 3:8-9

title: 08 | Upright
text:
“Upright” is another term for “just.” HIS word declares that HE is just. Let us seek to be upright and just in our interactions with one another so that the LORD is glorified in our lives.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Job 4:7

Week 2

Acts 10:22

Week 3

Proverbs 2:21

Week 4

Psalms 33:4

title: 09 | Great(ness, er)
text:
“Great” is often used to characterize something or someone that is outstanding! The LORD is referred to as mighty, marvelous and awesome: all synonyms of “great.” All of these words definitely describe HIM, and they may also describe HIS creation!
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Job 37:23

Week 2

Joel 2:21

Week 3

Matthew 18:1-5

Week 4

Psalms 95:3-4

title: Poems
text:
Savior’s Birth…  Miraculous  Awesome  Necessary  Gracious  Exalted  Redemptive  Humble place, heaven’s plan!

Pure  Eternal  Adonai  Complete  Everlasting  HE will keep you in perfect PEACE!

GOD is…  Timing - HIS is perfect  Refuge - from storms in life  Universe’s Creator  Sustainer - keeping us  Teacher  We can put our TRUST in HIM!

Jesus is our…  Rest when weary  Essential source  Friend  Uplifter  Guide in darkness  Everlasting Savior  Take REFUGE in HIM - HE never fails!

Our Savior is  Monumental  Adoni  Sinless  True  Exceptional  Redeemer  Only one worthy!

title: 10 | Gracious
text:
“Gracious” is a wonderful and lovely word. When we are gracious to each other, life seems good. I pray that we will follow JESUS and attempt to be gracious to each other on this journey we call life.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Psalms 67:1

Week 2

Isaiah 33:2

Week 3

Joel 2:13

Week 4

2 Kings 13:23

title: 11 | Goodness
text:
During this season or time of year, we see and experience the goodness of GOD and others in a special way. Being thankful or grateful for the kindness, generosity and care of people is generally reciprocated. It would be wonderful to experience this year round: Let that be our goal as believers in CHRIST!
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Psalms 31:19

Week 2

Hebrews 6:5

Week 3

Romans 15:14

Week 4

Amos 5:14

title: 12 | Everlasting
text:
“Everlasting” is used to described something that never ends. Something that never fails and is always constant and consistent. GOD’s love is everlasting!
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Psalms 90:2

Week 2

Psalms 139:23-24

Week 3

Isaiah 26:4

Week 4

Ezekiel 16:60

title: 01 | Judgement
text:
The term “judge” or “judgement” can invoke different emotions. These emotions can be negative or positive. The word of GOD tells us that HE is a righteous judge. HIS judgements maybe gracious or firm; whatever they are, HIS grace and mercy are available!
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Jeremiah 17:10

Week 2

Samuel 3:11-12

Week 3

Matthew 16:27

Week 4

Psalms 62:12

Week 5

2 Corinthians 5:9-10

title: 02 | Understanding
text:
“Understanding” means for one to gain insight from the information they read, see and hear. This is a gift from GOD. Being able to obtain understanding as it relates to the word of GOD is helpful. It allows us to navigate our journey. I pray for understanding as we study GOD’s word.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Psalms 119:99-100

Week 2

Job 26:14

Week 3

Acts 28:26-27

Week 4

Ephesians 5:15-17

title: Home
text:
Question to Prompt Your Study

Who is the audience in the text? Is it leaders, the church, etc.?
When is the action in the text happening? What is the time of day? What is the season?
Where is the action in the text happening?
Is the text in the Old Testament or New Testament?
What is the lesson in the text? What is the message? Is it providing instruction?
How can we apply the text in our current life?
Why is this text important?

title: 03 | Sovereign
text:
The sovereignty of the LORD is present throughout scripture. HE is, was and is to come! There is nothing that compares to HIM! We can rely on the omnipotent, omnipresent GOD for all that we need.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Psalms 103:19

Week 2

2 Chronicles 20:6

Week 3

Colossians 1:16-17

Week 4

Timothy 6:15-16

title: 04 | Trust
text:
“I trust GOD in all circumstances” is easy to say but hard to do. The HOLY SPIRIT is a helper in this area of our lives. Trusting requires us to believe in HIS word, despite what we see and hear. As we learn and grow in knowledge, may our trust in HIM increase!
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Proverbs 22:19

Week 2

Jeremiah 17:7

Week 3

Psalms 4:4-5

Week 4

Psalms 62:8

Week 5

Isaiah 26:3-4
